definitions.definition: To commit (official papers) to some office.
To place in an archive in a logical place and order
To store a file (aggregation of data) on a storage medium such as a disc or another computer.
(with for) To submit a formal request to some office.
definitions.example: She filed for divorce the next day.

definitions.definition: To set in order; to arrange, or lay away.

definitions.example: The applicants kept filing into the room until it was full.

definitions.definition: To smooth, grind, or cut with a file.
definitions.example: I'd better file the bottoms of the table legs. Otherwise they will scratch the flooring.
